plant_translocations.content: The study delved into the interaction between propanil and pyribenzoxim in barnyardgrass, particularly examining their impact on absorption and translocation. Propanil exhibited antagonism towards pyribenzoxim, especially at higher doses, when both were applied to the same leaf. Interestingly, no antagonism was observed when these herbicides were applied to separate leaves. Foliar absorption of pyribenzoxim was consistent, unaffected by propanil, accounting for approximately 32% of the total applied. However, the translocation of pyribenzoxim out of the treated leaf was significantly impacted by propanil. When both were applied to the same leaf, translocation reduced to 3.5%, indicating a substantial decrease compared to separate leaf applications. Chlorophyll fluorescence analysis revealed that propanil diminished the photosynthetic activity in the treated leaf but not in the untreated ones of the same plant. The study suggested that propanil hindered pyribenzoxim's whole-plant effectiveness by impeding its translocation to adjacent tissues, critical for pyribenzoxim's activity within five days of treatment. These findings underscored the importance of understanding the interplay between herbicides and their impact on the movement and effectiveness of each other within the plant system.
plant_translocations.reference: Koo, S. J., Kim, J.-S., Kim, J. S., & Kang, S. H. (2000). Antagonistic Interaction of Propanil and Pyribenzoxim on Barnyardgrass Control. Pesticide Biochemistry and Physiology, 67(1), 46–53. doi:10.1006/pest.2000.2476

method.Apply Location: Foliar application on the fourth leaf
method.Plant Growth Condition: Plants were grown in 10 × 15 cm plastic pots containing synthetic soil (Bunong Horticulture Mix No. 2, Korea) in a greenhouse maintained at 28-33°C during the day and 17-22°C at night. The greenhouse had a 12-hour photoperiod.
method.Chemical Preparation: Herbicide solutions of pyribenzoxim (98.2% purity) and propanil (96.5% purity) were prepared in acetone with 0.1% Tween 20. The pyribenzoxim solution was applied at a dose of 1 mg per plant, and the propanil solution at a dose of 50 mg per plant.
method.Received Pesticide of Plant: Each plant received activity 3.19 MBq/mg pesticide, dissolved in 20 μL of 50% acetone containing 0.1% Tween 20.
method.Other Information: Each treatment consisted of 10 single-plant replicates.
